title: HPSF Component Template
description: JSON Schema for HPSF (Honeycomb Pipeline Specification Format) component YAML templates

kind.description: The unique type of the component; there can be only one component with any given kind

name.description: What the user calls the component. The name here is used to fill in the default name (a number will be appended)

logo.description: Used to define the logo used for receivers and exporters. Valid logos are listed in hound NodeComponentLogo.tsx

type.description: The generalized type of component for broad classification

status.description: The development status of the component. alpha, stable, and archived are public; use development if you don't want people to see it without a feature flag

version.description: Version should be bumped when the component is updated

summary.description: The short description, easily visible in the UI and the sidebar

description.description: Longer description that only shows up on demand

tags.description: Help the user find and organize the component in the sidebar. Follow the key:value format

ports.description: The things that allow connections to other components

properties.description: The user-editable values for this component

validations.description: Component-level validations that apply across properties. Permitted validations: at_least_one_of, exactly_one_of, mutually_exclusive, require_together, conditional_require_together

oneOf.description: at_least_one_of validation with comma-separated property names in parentheses
exactly_one_of validation with comma-separated property names in parentheses
mutually_exclusive validation with comma-separated property names in parentheses
require_together validation with comma-separated property names in parentheses
conditional_require_together validation with condition property, condition value, and dependent properties

templates.description: Control how this component is rendered in configurations. There can be multiple entries if the component can generate more than one template

TemplatePort.description: A port on a component where data flows in or out

name.description: The name that shows up in the UI next to the handle. Used in connections between components. Changing name across versions is a BREAKING change and requires a major version bump

direction.description: Note that receivers have output ports and exporters have input ports

type.description: Be careful to specify the port types accurately

index.description: Optional index to control port ordering in the UI

TemplateProperty.description: A user-settable value that can be used to configure the component

name.description: The name of the property; this is used by the templates so the name should be a valid Go identifier

display.description: Human-readable label for the property shown in the UI

type.description: The datatype of the value and partly controls the property editor that will be used for this value

oneOf.description: String-based subtype for property editor constraints; e.g., oneof() for dropdowns
Array-based subtype for checklist properties containing item definitions

id.description: Unique identifier for the checklist item

displayName.description: Human-readable name shown in the UI

value.description: The actual value used when this item is selected

tooltipText.description: Optional tooltip text providing more information about the item

advanced.description: If true, this property shows up under 'Advanced' and is hidden by default

validations.description: Constraints on the value, independent of the property editor. Permitted validations can be found in templateComponent.go

oneOf.description: oneof validation with comma-separated values in parentheses
atleast validation with numeric value in parentheses
atmost validation with numeric value in parentheses
inrange validation with two numeric values (integers or floats) in parentheses

default.description: The default value for the property. Type depends on the property type

TemplateData.description: A template for generating configuration data

kind.description: The type of configuration data it generates

name.description: Used to identify the template. Should be unique

format.description: The format of the data. This is an escape hatch for specialized components

meta.description: Extra component-level info. Contents depend on the format

componentSection.description: For collectors: exporters, receivers, processors etc

signalTypes.description: For collectors: array of which signal types this component handles

collectorComponentName.description: For collectors: the name by which the underlying collector component is known

env.description: For refinery rules: the environment for the rules. Can use template variables

sampler.description: For refinery rules: the kind of sampler being configured (the name used in Refinery configs)

condition.description: For refinery rules: indicates if this is a condition component

scope.description: For refinery rules: the scope for condition evaluation (e.g., 'span', 'trace')

data.description: Run through Go's text/templates to convert them to configurations

TemplateDataItem.description: A single key-value pair in template data

key.description: The name of the yaml key under which this value will be stored. For non-collectors, this is a 'dotted' key. For refinery rules, special key '!condition!' indicates a semicolon-separated list of key=value pairs

value.description: The value of the key that should end up in the config. Can contain Go template expressions, be an object for empty configurations, primitive values, or arrays

suppress_if.description: A value that evaluates to nonzero if the entire key/value pair should be omitted. Can contain Go template expressions
